entries.content: Frame your offering as the 'UK's first mobile petrol station' to highlight novelty and unique convenience.
Address price skepticism by explaining lower overheads (mobile vs. physical station) allow passing savings to the customer, rather than criticizing competitor pricing.
Counter quality concerns by stating all standard fuel in the UK comes from the same few refineries and is regulated to be the exact same quality everywhere.
entries.notes: Directly addresses the 'watered down fuel' objection by citing industry facts.

entries.content: Recognize that convenience is a strong market need people will pay for, even before considering price advantages.
Position the company as a 'disruptor' setting a new standard, rather than just another competitor.
It's saving people money, it's saving people time and it's convenient. Why wouldn't you sign up?
entries.notes: Concise summary of the unique value proposition.

entries.content: Explain that regulation ensures the product quality is identical to competitors, removing quality as a variable in the comparison.

focus_area: Competitive Objections: Unique value framing without attacking others
